Visual Cortex.description: The primary visual processing area in the brain

Retina.description: The light-sensitive tissue lining the inner surface of the eye

Photoreceptor Cells.description: Specialized cells in the retina that convert light into electrical signals

Rods.description: Photoreceptor cells responsible for vision in low light conditions

Cones.description: Photoreceptor cells responsible for color vision and high visual acuity

Bipolar Cells.description: Neurons in the retina that transmit signals from photoreceptor cells to ganglion cells

Ganglion Cells.description: Neurons in the retina whose axons form the optic nerve

Optic Nerve.description: The nerve that carries visual information from the retina to the brain

Lateral Geniculate Nucleus.description: A relay center in the thalamus that processes visual information before sending it to the visual cortex

V1 (Primary Visual Cortex).description: The first cortical area to receive visual input

V2 (Secondary Visual Cortex).description: Processes information from V1, further refining visual perception

V4.description: Involved in color perception and object recognition

Superior Colliculus.description: Plays a role in orienting visual attention

Parietal Lobe.description: Integrates visual information with other sensory modalities for spatial awareness
